object.content:
So my conclusion on Derek.
I got sucked into watching all 7 episodes of Derek on Netflix tonight, because - it’s so frick’n beautiful - the episodes are only half an hour - and it isn’t overly cliche, until episode 7. 

The show has a great respect for aged, without glorifying it. It challenges cultural norms - particularly the shallowness of youth culture, the disregard for the aged, materialism, friendship…

The main character, Derek, is mentally slow and has such a wonderful heart and Ricky Gervais plays him so neatly. It really was a surprise for me. Hannah, Dougie, Kevin and the rest are played so admirably, and with such character, well - not Kevin.

But the ending felt somewhat shallow. And maybe that because it was only 7 episodes and they wanted to give it a nice tidy ending. But “Be like Derek” is…

Well, it could have been more. It came off a bit shallow in the end, sweet - nice - but shallow. 

Do watch it, its fantastic. Even with the last episode. Its a great conversation starter. And I will probably re-watch the entire season over the next few months.
